Subject: Eric S. Raymond 'Ask Me Anything!'
Description: Eric S. Raymond answers your questions about anything!  Speakers include:Eric S. Raymond - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Where Did the Heroes Go?
Description: Science fiction and fantasy were once known for stories with strong, capable heroes and heroines. We take a look at heroes and what's happened to them lately.  Speakers include:Jay Maynard, Eric S. Raymond, Jon Davis, Stewart Sternberg, Christine Daigle - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Tastes that Taste Great Together
Description: Join Cathy and Eric Raymond for a different kind of chocolate tasting: tastes of dark chocolate combined with other flavors and foods, such as bacon!  Or vanilla!  This tasting will include a talk about foods that were historically combined with chocolate in South America and, later, in Europe.  Speakers include:Cathy Raymond, Eric S. Raymond - Track: Food  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Tools for Outlines: M.I.C.E., The Three Act Structure
Description: Is your story about Milieu, an Idea, a Character, or an Event? Figure out what sort of story you want to tell, and see which elements are most important, how you might want to structure the story, and how to tell if you've reached the end.   Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Michael K. Elliot, Angie Rush - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Mechanics of Magic in Fantasy & SF
Description: Does a magical system for a story need rules? Costs, unintended consequences, social factors? What about reliability issues? How can we avoid worn-out tropes. How should magic in an RPG and story differ? Is some of the tech in SF 'magic' and should the same considerations apply?  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Cathrynne Valente - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
